thread.title: 3 celebrities with Texas ties saw the inside of a jail cell this weekend
thread.title_full: 3 celebrities with Texas ties saw the inside of a jail cell this weekend - San Antonio Express-News

author: Joshua Fechter
title: 3 celebrities with Texas ties saw the inside of a jail cell this weekend
text:
Photo: AP Image 1 of / 89 89 In a photo provided by the Vermont State Police, actor Randy Quaid stands in the Vermont State Police barracks in St. Albans, Vt., Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. State Police say Quaid has been taken into custody while trying to cross from Canada into the United States. State Police say the "Independence Day" actor was detained by troopers at the Highgate Springs port of entry, days after Canadian officials said he would be deported. Quaid is wanted in Santa Barbara, Calif., to face felony vandalism charges filed in 2010 after he and his wife, Evi, were found squatting in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned. (Vermont State Police via AP)
Photo: AP In a photo provided by the Vermont State Police, actor Randy Quaid... Image 2 of 89 In a photo provided by the Vermont State Police, Evi Quaid stands in the Vermont State Police barracks in St. Albans, Vt., Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. Quaid and her husband, actor Randy Qaid, were taken into custody Friday while trying to cross from Canada into the United States. Randy Quaid is wanted in Santa Barbara, Calif., to face felony vandalism charges filed in 2010 after he and his wife were found squatting in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned. The two skipped several court appearances and went to Canada, where Evi Quaid was granted citizenship. (Vermont State Police via AP)
Photo: AP In a photo provided by the Vermont State Police, Evi Quaid stands... Image 3 of 89
Shia LaBeouf was arrested on a misdemeanor public intoxication charge on Friday, October 9, 2015 and booked in the Travis County Jail in Austin, Texas.
Photo: Travis County Sheriff's Department Shia LaBeouf was arrested on a misdemeanor public intoxication...
Image 4 of 89 Rapper Scarface, also known as Brad Jordan, was arrested in Atlanta for allegedly not paying child support. He was attending a BET Hip Hop Awards Show at the time of his arrest.
Rapper Scarface, also known as Brad Jordan, was arrested in Atlanta... Image 5 of 89 Click through the slideshow to see celebrity mugshots through the years.

This booking photo provided by Summit County Sheriff's Department in Park City, Utah, on March 16, 2015, shows Actor Emile Hirsch. Hirsch made his first court appearance on Monday, after being charged with assault after putting a studio executive in a chokehold and dragging her across a nightclub table while he was in Utah for the Sundance Film Festival.
Photo: AP Photo/Summit County Sheriff's Department This booking photo provided by Summit County Sheriff's Department...
Image 7 of 89 This photo from the Charleston County, S.C. detention center shows actor Will Patton after his Tuesday, Feb. 24, 2015 arrest on a charge of driving under the influence. Patton, a native Charleston, S.C., was stopped on the nearby Isle of Palms, S.C. He later was released from jail on a personal recognizance bond. (AP Photo/Courtesy of Charleston County Sheriffs Office)
Photo: Uncredited, HOPD This photo from the Charleston County, S.C. detention center shows... Image 8 of 89 In this arrest photo made available by the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office shows singer Robert Van Winkle, also know as Vanilla Ice, Wednesday, Feb. 18, 2015. Vanilla Ice was charged with breaking into and stealing from an abandoned home in Lantana, Fla. He was released on bond. (AP Photo/Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office) ORG XMIT: MH101

Photo: Getty Images Michael Jackson is pictured in a mug shot from the Santa Barbara... Image 89 of 89 3 celebrities with Texas ties saw the inside of a jail cell this weekend 1 / 89 Back to Gallery A handful of celebrities learned that they're not outside the reach of the law this weekend.
In a sweep of unrelated incidents on Friday, law enforcement agents arrested "Transformers" star Shia LaBeouf in Austin, rapper Scarface in Georgia and "Independence Day" actor Randy Quaid on the U.S.-Canada border.
Austin police arrested LaBeouf — star of three "Transformers" movies and the 2014 film "Fury — in the city's downtown bar district on a charge of public intoxication, a Class C misdemeanor.
An arrest affidavit alleges that LaBeouf and two women walked into oncoming traffic, tried to walk away from an officer, became aggressive when a man recorded the incident and got in the arresting officer's face saying, "do whatever the (expletive) you gotta do!"
LaBeouf was booked into Travis County Jail, but has since been released.
The actor has since fired off two vague tweets: " I talk, just not to you " and " bombs away ."
RELATED: Grammy-winning artist St. Vincent spent her weekend waiting tables at a Texas taqueria
More than 900 miles east in Atlanta, police arrested Houston native Brad Jordan , a rapper who goes by Scarface, on child support contempt charges just after receiving an award at the BET Hip Hop Awards on Friday.
Jordan remained in jail as of Monday afternoon, Fulton County Sheriff's Office spokeswoman Tracy Flanagan told mySA.com.
RELATED: Woman snorting something at Astros-Royals game raises eyebrows online
In Vermont, Randy Quaid — a Houston native and brother of actor Dennis Quaid — and wife Evi Quaid were being held on $500,000 after attempting to re-enter the United States from Canada, The Associated Press reported .
The married couple allegedly fled the United States five years ago after being accused of trashing and illegally squatting in a California house they used to own.
They have been charged with felony vandalism, failure to appear for court dates and illegally occupying the house.
jfechter@mySA.com
